intro: Cyrtandra karykrous, commonly known as the Kauai Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in the understory of native Hawaiian forests. Due to its restricted habitat and conservation status, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
